title: Rust compiler panic
body:
I was getting started with the standard documention on BufReader, but when I tried the example on BufRead.[readline](https://doc.rust-lang.org/std/io/trait.BufRead.html#method.read_line) I got an unexpected panic when compiling.

The rust compiler panics every time when trying to compile the following snippet of code:

```
use std::io::prelude::*;
use std::io::BufReader;

fn fun<R: Read>(input: R) {
    let buf_reader = BufReader::new(input);
    let mut buffer = Vec::new();

    while buf_reader.read_line(&mut buffer).unwrap() > 0 {

        buffer.clear();
    }
}

fn main() {
    println!("Hello, world!");
}
```
## Meta

I'm on Arch Linux using cargo and rust from the official repository:

```
community/rust 1:1.9.0-1 
community/cargo 0.10.0-2
```

`rustc --version --verbose`:

```
rustc 1.9.0
binary: rustc
commit-hash: unknown
commit-date: unknown
host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu
release: 1.9.0
```

Backtrace:

